TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SKRegion extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the geometric region used to specify clipping areas for drawing.

Docs.summary: Gets the bounds of this region.
Docs.remarks: If the region is empty, returns an empty rectangle.

Docs.summary: Check to see if the specified coordinates are completely inside the current region.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the specified coordinates are completely inside the current region, otherwise false.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Contains (SkiaSharp.SKRegion src);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class SkiaSharp.SKRegion src) cil managed

Docs.summary: Check to see if the specified region is completely inside the current region.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the specified region is completely inside the current region, otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: This works for simple (rectangular) and complex regions, and always returns the correct result. If either region is empty, this method returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath path);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SetPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path) cil managed

Docs.summary: Set this region to the area described by the path, clipped to the current region.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the resulting region is non-empty.
Docs.remarks: This produces a region that is identical to the pixels that would be drawn by the path (with no antialiasing) with the current region as the clip.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath path, SkiaSharp.SKRegion clip);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SetPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path, class SkiaSharp.SKRegion clip) cil managed

Docs.summary: Set this region to the area described by the path, clipped.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the resulting region is non-empty.
Docs.remarks: This produces a region that is identical to the pixels that would be drawn by the path (with no antialiasing) with the specified clip.
